cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 mi ENE of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn west-southwest on Tuesday, cross the northwestern Bahamas Wednesday, make landfall along the east-central Florida coast Wednesday night, then move westward across the peninsula and emerge briefly over the eastern Gulf near the central Florida coast before turning north toward Georgia/South Carolina.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near the Volusia/Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Volusia/Brevard County line southward to Hallandale Beach, FL; Storm Surge Watch North Palm Beach to Hallandale Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Hallandale Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA; Storm Surge Warning North Palm Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA including lower St. Johns River; Hurricane Warning for north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas, Florida east coast, portions of the Florida peninsula (including central Gulf coast), and southeastern U.S. coast up through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph, higher gusts) possible late Wednesday night through Thursday as the center moves across the peninsula.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (<3 ft) if the center emerges briefly into the eastern Gulf, but no official surge warning for Tampa at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with local amounts up to 7 inches possible, producing ponding, localized flooding, and reduced visibility.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine conditions and rough seas in Tampa Bay and approaches; possible short-fuse tornadoes in outer rainbands.
